alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 7:14AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Crittenden and St. Francis. In West Tennessee, Fayette, Haywood, Shelby and Tipton. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 714 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, West Memphis, Marion, Millington, Covington, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Cordova, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Munford, Brighton, Crawfordsville, Edmondson, Sunset, Jericho and Jennette. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
